channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Ambari
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Ambari

item.title: CVE-2018-8003|2024-08-05T06:37:59.710Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description: Apache Ambari, versions 1.4.0 to 2.6.1, is susceptible to a directory traversal attack allowing an unauthenticated user to craft an HTTP request which provides read-only access to any file on the filesystem of the host the Ambari Server runs on that is accessible by the user the Ambari Server is running as. Direct network access to the Ambari Server is required to issue this request, and those Ambari Servers that are protected behind a firewall, or in a restricted network zone are at less risk of being affected by this issue.

item.title: CVE-2018-8042|2024-08-05T06:46:12.943Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description: Apache Ambari, version 2.5.0 to 2.6.2, passwords for Hadoop credential stores are exposed in Ambari Agent informational log messages when the credential store feature is enabled for eligible services. For example, Hive and Oozie.

item.title: CVE-2017-5654|2024-08-05T15:11:48.668Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description: In Ambari 2.4.x (before 2.4.3) and Ambari 2.5.0, an authorized user of the Ambari Hive View may be able to gain unauthorized read access to files on the host where the Ambari server executes.

item.title: CVE-2017-5655|2024-08-05T15:11:47.387Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description: In Ambari 2.2.2 through 2.4.2 and Ambari 2.5.0, sensitive data may be stored on disk in temporary files on the Ambari Server host. The temporary files are readable by any user authenticated on the host.

item.title: CVE-2017-5642|2024-08-05T15:04:15.357Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description: During installation of Ambari 2.4.0 through 2.4.2, Ambari Server artifacts are not created with proper ACLs.

item.title: CVE-2023-50379|2024-08-02T22:16:46.331Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description:
Malicious code injection in Apache Ambari in prior to 2.7.8. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.7.8, which fixes this issue.
Impact: A Cluster Operator can manipulate the request by adding a malicious code injection and gain a root over the cluster main host.

item.title: CVE-2023-50380|2024-08-02T22:16:46.320Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description:
XML External Entity injection in apache ambari versions <= 2.7.7, Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.7.8, which fixes this issue.
More Details:
Oozie Workflow Scheduler had a vulnerability that allowed for root-level file reading and privilege escalation from low-privilege users. The vulnerability was caused through lack of proper user input validation.
This vulnerability is known as an XML External Entity (XXE) injection attack. Attackers can exploit XXE vulnerabilities to read arbitrary files on the server, including sensitive system files. In theory, it might be possible to use this to escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2023-50378|2024-08-02T22:16:46.837Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description:
Lack of proper input validation and constraint enforcement in Apache Ambari prior to 2.7.8
Impact : As it will be stored XSS, Could be exploited to perform unauthorized actions, varying from data access to session hijacking and delivering malicious payloads.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.7.8 which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-50378|2024-06-04T17:17:39.090Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description:
Lack of proper input validation and constraint enforcement in Apache Ambari prior to 2.7.8

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.7.8 which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-50379|2024-02-27T08:27:03.120Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description:
Malicious code injection in Apache Ambari in prior to 2.7.8. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.7.8, which fixes this issue.
Impact: A Cluster Operator can manipulate the request by adding a malicious code injection and gain a root over the cluster main host.

item.title: CVE-2023-50380|2024-02-27T16:51:33.978Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ambari
item.description:
XML External Entity injection in apache ambari versions <= 2.7.7, Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.7.8, which fixes this issue.
More Details:
Oozie Workflow Scheduler had a vulnerability that allowed for root-level file reading and privilege escalation from low-privilege users. The vulnerability was caused through lack of proper user input validation.
This vulnerability is known as an XML External Entity (XXE) injection attack. Attackers can exploit XXE vulnerabilities to read arbitrary files on the server, including sensitive system files. In theory, it might be possible to use this to escalate privileges.
